title: Jade Goody's son Bobby posts message of gratitude as he continues apprenticeship
text:

Bobby Brazier has shared that he is "blessed" as he carves out a career for himself shortly after finishing school.

The son of Jade Goody and Jeff Brazier, 16, took to social media to share his thoughts as he continues his social media apprenticeship that he began last month.

Proving he is grateful for the opportunity and willing to learn, he uploaded a mirror selfie onto his Instagram account alongside a thoughtful caption.

The recent school-leaver wrote: "Blessings on blessings on blessings, look at my life man that’s lessons on lessons on lessons.

(Image: bobbybrazier/Instagram)



"StayHumble StayGrateful StayBusy."

In the snap, the trendy lad wore a grey roll neck sweater teamed with dark slim leg jeans.

Last month, ahead of starting his apprenticeship in the capital, Bobby's TV presenter dad took to Twitter to share how proud he was.

An overwhelmed Jeff, 40, shared a tweet revealing that Bobby was starting an apprenticeship in social media after deciding to take on a more vocational role instead of continuing his studies.

(Image: Instagram)

On Twitter he wrote: "Such a proud day. Bob starts his apprenticeship in London.

"So much progress has been made in such short time and I feel immensely satisfied knowing that he has all of the tools to go and develop at his own pace into whatever he wishes to become. Much love."

Brazier explained his son's decision not to take on A-levels, adding that "he knew he didn't want to spend another 2 years studying subjects he wasn't sure he really liked and I'm not one for seeing him go through the motions so I think being in a real working environment is best for him right now".

(Image: UGC)

(Image: Shared Content Unit)

Bobby is raised by his father Jeff alongside his brother Fred after his mother Jade passed away following a battle with cervical cancer at the age of 27 in 2009.

The UK tuned in to watch the devastating sequences in the lead up to Jade's death on new three-part Channel 4 documentary series The Reality Star Who Changed Britain.

Fans were in tears after emotional scenes of Jade receiving her cancer diagnosis on Indian TV Bigg Boss was aired during the final episode.
description: The recent school leaver took to social media to share he is grateful as he carries on his social media apprenticeship
